00011 void usage() {
00012   using namespace std;
00013   cout << "usage: odb_check [-h | --help] [--usage] -d data_dir [-c corr_dir] [-r first_run last_run] [run1 [run2...]]" << endl;
00014 }
00015 
00016 void help() {
00017   using namespace std;
00018   usage();
00019   cout <<
00020     "odb_check: Read in shapes histogram from alcapana output files," << endl <<
00021     "           estimate certain values, and then output to corrections file." << endl <<
00022     " -d      : Followed by place where hist directory and corr directory are." << endl <<
00023     "           The corrections files are saved to data_dir/corr/ if" << endl <<
00024     "           -c flag is no specified." << endl <<
00025     " -c      : The directory where the correction files are stored. If not specified," << endl <<
00026     "           data_dir/corr/ is assumed." << endl <<
00027     " -r      : Followed by two numbers indicating a range of runs to process." << endl <<
00028     " run1... : Any arguments not associated with a flag are assumed to be run" << endl <<
00029     "           numbers to process." << endl;
00030 }
00031 
00032 bool parse_args(int argc, char* argv[], std::vector<int>& runs, std::string& data_dir, std::string& corr_dir) {
00033   if (argc == 1) {
00034     help();
00035     return false;
00036   }
00037   for (int i = 1; i < argc; ++i) {
00038     std::string iarg(argv[i]);
00039     if (iarg == "-h" || iarg == "--help") {
00040       help();
00041       return false;
00042     } else if (iarg == "--usage") {
00043       usage();
00044       return false;
00045     } else if (iarg == "-d") {
00046       if (++i != argc) {
00047         data_dir = std::string(argv[i]);
00048         if (data_dir[data_dir.size() - 1] != '/')
00049           data_dir += '/';
00050         continue;
00051       } else {
00052         std::cout << "ERROR: Nothing following -d flag!" << std::endl;
00053         return false;
00054       }
00055     } else if (iarg == "-c") {
00056       if (++i != argc) {
00057         corr_dir = std::string(argv[i]);
00058         if (corr_dir[corr_dir.size() - 1] != '/')
00059           corr_dir += '/';
00060         continue;
00061       } else {
00062         std::cout << "ERROR: Nothing following -c flag!" << std::endl;
00063       }
00064     } else if (iarg == "-r") {
00065       std::stringstream ss;
00066       int rlow, rhigh;
00067       if (i + 2 >= argc) {
00068         std::cout << "ERROR: Not enough arguments following -r flag!" << std::endl;
00069         return false;
00070       }
00071       ss << argv[i + 1] << " " << argv[i + 2];
00072       ss >> rlow >> rhigh;
00073       i += 2;
00074       if (rlow == 0 || rhigh == 0) {
00075         std::cout <<
00076           "ERROR: Either 0 or a non-numerical value was passed as a run number." << std::endl <<
00077           "       Neither can be processed." << std::endl;
00078         return false;
00079       } else if (rlow >= rhigh) {
00080         std::cout << "ERROR: The first run following the -r option must be smaller than the second!" << std::endl;
00081         return false;
00082       } else if (rlow < 0) {
00083         std::cout << "ERROR: Cannot process negative run number!" << std::endl;
00084         return false;
00085       }
00086       for (int r = rlow; r <= rhigh; ++r)
00087         runs.push_back(r);
00088     } else {
00089       std::stringstream ss;
00090       int r;
00091       ss << iarg;
00092       ss >> r;
00093       if (r == 0) {
00094         std::cout <<
00095           "ERROR: Either 0 or a non-numerical value was passed as a run number." << std::endl <<
00096           "       Neither can be processed." << std::endl;
00097         return false;
00098       } else if (r < 0) {
00099         std::cout << "ERROR: Cannot process negative run number!" << std::endl;
00100         return false;
00101       }
00102       runs.push_back(r);
00103     }
00104   }
00105   if (runs.size() == 0) {
00106     std::cout << "ERROR: No runs to process!" << std::endl;
00107     return false;
00108   } else if (data_dir.size() == 0) {
00109     std::cout << "ERROR: No data directory indicated!" << std::endl;
00110     return false;
00111   }
00112   if (corr_dir.size() == 0)
00113     corr_dir = data_dir + "corr/";
00114   return true;
00115 }
00116 
00117 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00118   // First and foremost, check that we can read in files
00119   if(gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TVirtualStreamerInfo") == NULL)
00120     gROOT->GetPluginManager()->AddHandler("TVirtualStreamerInfo","*","TStreamerInfo","RIO","TStreamerInfo()");
00121 
00122   // Next, process command line arguments
00123   std::vector<int> runs;
00124   std::string data_dir;
00125   std::string corr_dir;
00126 
00127   if (!parse_args(argc, argv, runs, data_dir, corr_dir))
00128     return 1;
00129 
00130   ODBCheck x;
00131   std::string raw_dir = data_dir + "raw/";
00132   std::string odb_dir = data_dir + "odb/";
00133   std::string hist_dir = data_dir + "hist/";
00134   x.SetDirs(raw_dir, odb_dir, hist_dir, corr_dir);
00135   for (int r = 0; r < (int)runs.size(); ++r) {
00136     std::cout << "Checking run " << runs[r] << "..." << std::endl;
00137     x.Check(runs[r]);
00138   }
00139 }
